required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: ALX-0061 Phase I Bioavailability Study in Healthy Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I, Open-Label Study Evaluating the Bioavailability of ALX-0061 After Subcutaneous and Intravenous Administration in Healthy Volunteers.

brief_summary.textblock:
The overall aims of the study are:
- To assess the bioavailability of single doses of ALX-0061, administered s.c. at three dose levels, using 2 corresponding single i.v. dose levels as reference.
- To provide additional information on pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of ALX-0061.
- To further determine the safety and tolerability of ALX-0061.
- To further evaluate the systemic (serum) immunogenicity of ALX-0061.

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics: serum concentration of ALX-0061 after single subcutaneous (s.c.) and single intravenous (i.v.) doses of ALX-0061 in healthy volunteers
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to Day 32 +/- 2 days after dosing for low dose treatment arms, Day 1 to Day 46 +/-2 days after dosing for middle dose treatment arm, Day 1 to Day 53 +/- 2 days after dosing for high dose treatment arms

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacodynamics: concentration in plasma of total soluble Interleukin-6 receptor (sIL-6R) and in serum of IL-6
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During screening untill final visit (i.e. 60 +/- 2 days after dosing for the low dose and middle dose treatment arms and 83 +/- 2 days after dosing for the high dose treatment arms)
From signing of informed consent until final visit (i.e. 60 +/- 2 days for the low dose and middle dose treatment arms and 83 +/- 2 days for the high dose treatment arms
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events and concomitant medication Clinical laboratory Vital signs 12-lead ECG Physical examination Local reactions

secondary_outcome.measure: Immunogenicity: concentration of Anti-Drug Antibodies (ADA) in serum
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening until final visit (i.e. 60+/- 2 days after dosing for the low dose and middle dose treatment arms and 83 +/- 2 days after dosing for the high dose treatment arms

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
1. Healthy volunteers.
2. Gender: male or female.
3. Age 18 to 55 years.
4. Body mass index (BMI): 18.0 â‰¥ BMI < 30.0 kg/m2.
Key Exclusion Criteria:
1. Any active inflammatory condition, or autoimmune disorder such as lupus erythematosus, multiple sclerosis or rheumatoid arthritis (RA).
2. Any current or recent (within 4 weeks prior to dose) signs or symptoms of infection that requires parenteral antibiotic administration.
3. Symptomatic infection, or suspicion thereof in the last 1 week prior to dosing.
